forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 46. Southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. North wind around 6 mph.

weather_report:
In the cool embrace of a January night in Downtown San Francisco, serenity reigns. The skies, unbroken and clear, lead toward a low temperature that gently nudges against the chill of 46 degrees. A soft breeze whispers through the streets, barely stirring at 5 mph, while the daylight hours have bestowed a subtle warmth upon the city. Tomorrow promises more solace, as the sun will envelop the bay with radiant clarity, pushing temperatures to 58 degrees before tenderly retreating to a mellow 55 in the afternoon, cradled by a gentle north wind.

The evening invitingly beckons quiet walks through the cityscape, illuminated by the twinkling lights that reflect the vestige of a day well spent. The absence of fog allows vistas to stretch boundlessly, offering uninterrupted views of iconic landmarks standing proud against the Atlantic. Though the chill necessitates a light jacket, the largely clear conditions render outdoor exploration a truly delightful endeavor. A leisurely stroll along the waterfront, perhaps paired with a warm beverage, captures the essence of this tranquil San Francisco evening, balancing quietude with the vibrant energy that eternally lingers in the air.
